message:
“Let’s be clear, traffickers are in the business to make money,” she said. “The commodity they sell is a human being, but they would go out of business if someone wasn’t buying it.”
Rhodes told the audience how they could get involved by hosting fundraisers, donating money and supplies, talking to their children and advocating for legislative changes.

data.description: The Lehigh Valley Community Foundation, partnered with the United Way of the Greater Lehigh Valley, hosted a Wednesday night program, Hidden Crisis: Human Trafficking in our Community.
data.title: Program raises awareness on human trafficking in the Lehigh Valley; grants awarded to local groups
